AWS::AIOps::InvestigationGroup.defaultBehavior: Encryption configuration optional. Check AWS documentation for service-specific defaults.

AWS::APS::Workspace.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for APS by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::AmazonMQ::Broker.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS owned key by default when EncryptionOptions not specified.
AWS::AmazonMQ::Broker.notes: Set UseAwsOwnedKey to false and provide KmsKeyId for customer managed encryption.

AWS::AppConfig::ConfigurationProfile.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for AppConfig by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::AppConfig::Deployment.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for AppConfig by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::AppFlow::ConnectorProfile.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for AppFlow by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::AppFlow::Flow.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for AppFlow by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::AppIntegrations::DataIntegration.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for AppIntegrations by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.
AWS::AppIntegrations::DataIntegration.notes: Some encryption properties are required. Supports customer managed KMS keys.

AWS::AppRunner::Service.defaultBehavior: Encryption configuration optional. Check AWS documentation for service-specific defaults.

AWS::AppSync::ApiCache.defaultBehavior: Encryption behavior depends on service configuration. Refer to AWS documentation for details.
AWS::AppSync::ApiCache.notes: Refer to AWS documentation for encryption configuration details.

AWS::Backup::BackupVault.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key if EncryptionKeyArn not specified.
AWS::Backup::BackupVault.notes: All backups in the vault are encrypted. Encryption key cannot be changed after vault creation.

AWS::BackupGateway::Hypervisor.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for BackupGateway by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::Bedrock::Agent.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for Bedrock by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::Bedrock::AutomatedReasoningPolicy.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for Bedrock by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::Bedrock::Blueprint.defaultBehavior: Encryption behavior depends on service configuration. Refer to AWS documentation for details.

AWS::Bedrock::DataAutomationProject.defaultBehavior: Encryption behavior depends on service configuration. Refer to AWS documentation for details.

AWS::Bedrock::DataSource.defaultBehavior: Encryption configuration optional. Check AWS documentation for service-specific defaults.

AWS::Bedrock::Flow.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for Bedrock by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::Bedrock::Guardrail.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for Bedrock by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::Bedrock::Prompt.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for Bedrock by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::BedrockAgentCore::Gateway.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for BedrockAgentCore by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::BedrockAgentCore::Memory.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for BedrockAgentCore by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::Cassandra::Table.defaultBehavior: Encryption configuration optional. Check AWS documentation for service-specific defaults.

AWS::CleanRooms::IdMappingTable.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for CleanRooms by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::CloudTrail::EventDataStore.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for CloudTrail by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::CloudTrail::Trail.defaultBehavior: Log files encrypted with S3 server-side encryption by default.
AWS::CloudTrail::Trail.notes: Can specify KMS key for additional encryption. CloudTrail must have permissions to use the key.

AWS::CodeArtifact::Domain.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for CodeArtifact by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::CodeBuild::Project.defaultBehavior: Build artifacts encrypted with AWS managed S3 key by default.
AWS::CodeBuild::Project.notes: EncryptionKey applies to build output artifacts stored in S3.

AWS::CodeCommit::Repository.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for CodeCommit by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::CodeStarConnections::RepositoryLink.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for CodeStarConnections by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::Comprehend::DocumentClassifier.defaultBehavior: Encryption behavior depends on service configuration. Refer to AWS documentation for details.

AWS::Config::DeliveryChannel.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for Config by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::CustomerProfiles::Domain.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for CustomerProfiles by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::CustomerProfiles::ObjectType.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for CustomerProfiles by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::DAX::Cluster.notes: Encryption at rest for DAX clusters. Cannot be modified after cluster creation.

AWS::DMS::Endpoint.defaultBehavior: Encryption configuration optional. Check AWS documentation for service-specific defaults.
AWS::DMS::Endpoint.notes: Supports customer managed KMS keys. Encryption configured through nested properties.

AWS::DMS::InstanceProfile.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for DMS by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::DMS::ReplicationInstance.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for DMS by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::DSQL::Cluster.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for DSQL by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::DataBrew::Job.defaultBehavior: Encryption behavior depends on service configuration. Refer to AWS documentation for details.
AWS::DataBrew::Job.notes: Supports customer managed KMS keys. Supports multiple encryption types or algorithms.

AWS::DataSync::LocationHDFS.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for DataSync by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::DataZone::Domain.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for DataZone by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::Deadline::Farm.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for Deadline by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::DocDB::DBCluster.defaultBehavior: Not encrypted by default. Uses AWS managed key if StorageEncrypted is true but KmsKeyId not specified.
AWS::DocDB::DBCluster.notes: Encryption cannot be changed after cluster creation. Encrypts data at rest including underlying storage, backups, and snapshots.

AWS::DocDBElastic::Cluster.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for DocDBElastic by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::DynamoDB::GlobalTable.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS-owned key if SSEEnabled is false. Uses AWS-managed KMS key if SSEEnabled is true.
AWS::DynamoDB::GlobalTable.notes: SSEType only supports 'KMS'. Customer managed keys specified via ReplicaSpecification.SSESpecification.

AWS::DynamoDB::Table.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS-owned key if SSEEnabled is false or not specified. Uses AWS-managed key if SSEEnabled is true but KMSMasterKeyId is not specified.
AWS::DynamoDB::Table.notes: SSEType KMS is required when KMSMasterKeyId is specified.

AWS::EC2::Instance.defaultBehavior: EBS volumes follow account encryption-by-default setting. Root and data volumes can be encrypted independently.
AWS::EC2::Instance.notes: Encryption configured per volume in BlockDeviceMappings. Each volume can have different encryption settings.

AWS::EC2::VerifiedAccessEndpoint.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS owned key by default.
AWS::EC2::VerifiedAccessEndpoint.notes: Set CustomerManagedKeyEnabled to true and provide KmsKeyArn for customer managed encryption.

AWS::EC2::VerifiedAccessGroup.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS owned key by default.
AWS::EC2::VerifiedAccessGroup.notes: Set CustomerManagedKeyEnabled to true and provide KmsKeyArn for customer managed encryption.

AWS::EC2::VerifiedAccessTrustProvider.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS owned key by default.
AWS::EC2::VerifiedAccessTrustProvider.notes: Set CustomerManagedKeyEnabled to true and provide KmsKeyArn for customer managed encryption.

AWS::EC2::Volume.defaultBehavior: Depends on account encryption-by-default setting. If enabled, volumes are encrypted with default KMS key. If KmsKeyId is specified, Encrypted must be true.
AWS::EC2::Volume.notes: Encryption cannot be changed after volume creation. Supports key ID, alias, ARN, or alias ARN. Uses AWS managed key (alias/aws/ebs) if no key specified.

AWS::ECR::Repository.defaultBehavior: Uses AES256 encryption with Amazon S3-managed keys by default
AWS::ECR::Repository.notes: KmsKey is required if EncryptionType is KMS or KMS_DSSE. KMS_DSSE also available for dual-layer encryption.

AWS::ECR::RepositoryCreationTemplate.defaultBehavior: Encryption configuration optional. Check AWS documentation for service-specific defaults.

AWS::EFS::FileSystem.defaultBehavior: Not encrypted by default. Uses default EFS KMS key if Encrypted is true but KmsKeyId not specified
AWS::EFS::FileSystem.notes: Encryption cannot be changed after file system creation

AWS::EKS::Cluster.defaultBehavior: Secrets not encrypted with customer managed key by default.
AWS::EKS::Cluster.notes: Enables envelope encryption of Kubernetes secrets using KMS. Cannot be changed after cluster creation.

AWS::EMR::Studio.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for EMR by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::ElastiCache::ReplicationGroup.defaultBehavior: Not encrypted by default. Uses AWS managed key if AtRestEncryptionEnabled is true but KmsKeyId not specified.
AWS::ElastiCache::ReplicationGroup.notes: Encryption cannot be changed after creation. Only available for Redis replication groups.

AWS::ElastiCache::ServerlessCache.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for ElastiCache by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.
AWS::ElastiCache::ServerlessCache.notes: Supports customer managed KMS keys. Encryption settings typically cannot be changed after resource creation.

AWS::Elasticsearch::Domain.notes: AWS::Elasticsearch::Domain is being replaced by AWS::OpenSearchService::Domain

AWS::Events::Archive.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for Events by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::Events::Connection.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for Events by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::Events::EventBus.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for Events by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::FSx::FileSystem.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for FSx by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::FinSpace::Environment.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for FinSpace by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::Forecast::Dataset.defaultBehavior: Encryption configuration optional. Check AWS documentation for service-specific defaults.

AWS::Glue::DataCatalogEncryptionSettings.notes: SSE-KMS uses default Glue service key if no KmsKeyId specified. SSE-KMS-WITH-SERVICE-ROLE also available.

AWS::Glue::MLTransform.notes: SSE-KMS uses default Glue service key if no KmsKeyId specified.

AWS::Glue::SecurityConfiguration.defaultBehavior: Encryption configuration optional. Check AWS documentation for service-specific defaults.
AWS::Glue::SecurityConfiguration.notes: Some encryption properties are required. Encryption configured through nested properties.

AWS::GroundStation::MissionProfile.defaultBehavior: Encryption behavior depends on service configuration. Refer to AWS documentation for details.
AWS::GroundStation::MissionProfile.notes: Supports customer managed KMS keys. Encryption configured through nested properties.

AWS::HealthImaging::Datastore.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for HealthImaging by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::HealthLake::FHIRDatastore.defaultBehavior: Encryption configuration optional. Check AWS documentation for service-specific defaults.

AWS::ImageBuilder::Component.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for ImageBuilder by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::ImageBuilder::ContainerRecipe.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for ImageBuilder by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::ImageBuilder::Workflow.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for ImageBuilder by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::IoT::EncryptionConfiguration.defaultBehavior: Encryption behavior depends on service configuration. Refer to AWS documentation for details.
AWS::IoT::EncryptionConfiguration.notes: EncryptionType is required. KmsKeyArn required if using CUSTOMER_MANAGED_KMS_KEY.

AWS::Kendra::Index.defaultBehavior: Encryption configuration optional. Check AWS documentation for service-specific defaults.

AWS::Kinesis::Stream.notes: EncryptionType only supports 'KMS'. Both EncryptionType and KeyId are required when StreamEncryption is specified.

AWS::KinesisFirehose::DeliveryStream.defaultBehavior: Encryption configuration optional. Check AWS documentation for service-specific defaults.

AWS::KinesisVideo::Stream.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for KinesisVideo by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::Lambda::EventSourceMapping.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for Lambda by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::Lambda::Function.defaultBehavior: Environment variables encrypted with AWS managed key by default.
AWS::Lambda::Function.notes: KmsKeyArn only applies to environment variable encryption, not function code or layers.

AWS::Location::GeofenceCollection.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for Location by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::Location::Tracker.defaultBehavior: Encryption behavior depends on service configuration. Refer to AWS documentation for details.

AWS::Logs::LogAnomalyDetector.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for Logs by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::Logs::LogGroup.defaultBehavior: Encrypted with AWS managed key by default.
AWS::Logs::LogGroup.notes: Can specify customer managed KMS key. Encryption applies to log data at rest.

AWS::LookoutEquipment::InferenceSchedule.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for LookoutEquipment by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::LookoutMetrics::AnomalyDetector.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for LookoutMetrics by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::M2::Application.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for M2 by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::M2::Environment.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for M2 by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::MSK::Cluster.defaultBehavior: MSK creates and uses an AWS managed key if EncryptionInfo not specified.
AWS::MSK::Cluster.notes: DataVolumeKMSKeyId is required when EncryptionAtRest is specified. Cannot be changed after cluster creation.

AWS::MWAA::Environment.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for MWAA by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::MediaConnect::FlowEntitlement.defaultBehavior: Encryption configuration optional. Check AWS documentation for service-specific defaults.

AWS::MediaConnect::FlowOutput.defaultBehavior: Encryption configuration optional. Check AWS documentation for service-specific defaults.

AWS::MemoryDB::Cluster.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for MemoryDB by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::Neptune::DBCluster.defaultBehavior: Not encrypted by default. Uses AWS managed key if encryption enabled without specifying KMS key.
AWS::Neptune::DBCluster.notes: Supports customer managed KMS keys. Encryption settings typically cannot be changed after resource creation.

AWS::NimbleStudio::Studio.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS owned key by default if StudioEncryptionConfiguration not specified.
AWS::NimbleStudio::Studio.notes: KeyType is required when StudioEncryptionConfiguration is specified. KeyArn required if KeyType is CUSTOMER_MANAGED_KEY.

AWS::OSIS::Pipeline.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS owned key by default. Specify EncryptionAtRestOptions with KmsKeyArn for customer managed encryption.
AWS::OSIS::Pipeline.notes: KmsKeyArn is required when EncryptionAtRestOptions is specified.

AWS::Omics::AnnotationStore.defaultBehavior: Encryption configuration optional. Check AWS documentation for service-specific defaults.
AWS::Omics::AnnotationStore.notes: Type only supports 'KMS' and is required when SseConfig is specified.

AWS::Omics::ReferenceStore.defaultBehavior: Encryption configuration optional. Check AWS documentation for service-specific defaults.
AWS::Omics::ReferenceStore.notes: Type only supports 'KMS' and is required when SseConfig is specified.

AWS::Omics::SequenceStore.defaultBehavior: Encryption configuration optional. Check AWS documentation for service-specific defaults.
AWS::Omics::SequenceStore.notes: Type only supports 'KMS' and is required when SseConfig is specified.

AWS::Omics::VariantStore.defaultBehavior: Encryption configuration optional. Check AWS documentation for service-specific defaults.
AWS::Omics::VariantStore.notes: Type only supports 'KMS' and is required when SseConfig is specified.

AWS::OpenSearchService::Domain.notes: Required if fine-grained access control is enabled. Changing after creation causes domain replacement

AWS::Personalize::DatasetGroup.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for Personalize by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::Pipes::Pipe.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for Pipes by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::Proton::EnvironmentTemplate.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for Proton by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::Proton::ServiceTemplate.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for Proton by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::QBusiness::Application.defaultBehavior: Encryption configuration optional. Check AWS documentation for service-specific defaults.

AWS::QLDB::Ledger.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for QLDB by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::RDS::CustomDBEngineVersion.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for RDS by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.
AWS::RDS::CustomDBEngineVersion.notes: Supports customer managed KMS keys. Encryption settings typically cannot be changed after resource creation.

AWS::RDS::DBCluster.defaultBehavior: Not encrypted by default. Uses AWS managed key if encryption enabled without specifying KMS key.
AWS::RDS::DBCluster.notes: Supports customer managed KMS keys. Encryption settings typically cannot be changed after resource creation.

AWS::RDS::DBInstance.defaultBehavior: Not encrypted by default. If KmsKeyId is specified, StorageEncrypted must be true
AWS::RDS::DBInstance.notes: Different encryption contexts for storage, performance insights, and backup replication

AWS::RDS::GlobalCluster.defaultBehavior: Encryption behavior depends on service configuration. Refer to AWS documentation for details.
AWS::RDS::GlobalCluster.notes: Encryption settings typically cannot be changed after resource creation.

AWS::RDS::Integration.defaultBehavior: Encryption behavior depends on service configuration. Refer to AWS documentation for details.
AWS::RDS::Integration.notes: Supports customer managed KMS keys. Encryption settings typically cannot be changed after resource creation.

AWS::Redshift::Cluster.defaultBehavior: Not encrypted by default. Uses AWS managed key if Encrypted is true but KmsKeyId not specified.
AWS::Redshift::Cluster.notes: Encryption can be changed after creation but requires cluster modification. Encrypts data blocks, system metadata, and snapshots.

AWS::Redshift::Integration.defaultBehavior: Encryption behavior depends on service configuration. Refer to AWS documentation for details.
AWS::Redshift::Integration.notes: Supports customer managed KMS keys. Encryption settings typically cannot be changed after resource creation.

AWS::RedshiftServerless::Namespace.defaultBehavior: Encryption behavior depends on service configuration. Refer to AWS documentation for details.

AWS::Rekognition::StreamProcessor.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for Rekognition by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::S3::Bucket.defaultBehavior: AWS now enables default encryption for new buckets using SSE-S3
AWS::S3::Bucket.notes: Supports SSE-S3 (AES256), SSE-KMS (aws:kms), and DSSE-KMS (aws:kms:dsse) encryption types

AWS::S3Express::DirectoryBucket.defaultBehavior: Encryption configuration optional. Check AWS documentation for service-specific defaults.

AWS::S3Tables::TableBucket.defaultBehavior: Encryption configuration optional. Check AWS documentation for service-specific defaults.

AWS::S3Vectors::VectorBucket.defaultBehavior: Encryption configuration optional. Check AWS documentation for service-specific defaults.

AWS::SES::MailManagerArchive.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for SES by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::SNS::Topic.notes: When KmsMasterKeyId is specified, messages are encrypted at rest using the specified KMS key.

AWS::SQS::Queue.defaultBehavior: SQS-managed encryption (SSE-SQS) enabled by default for new queues.
AWS::SQS::Queue.notes: KmsMasterKeyId and SqsManagedSseEnabled are mutually exclusive. Use KmsMasterKeyId for customer-managed KMS, or SqsManagedSseEnabled=true for SQS-managed encryption.

AWS::SSM::ResourceDataSync.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for SSM by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::SageMaker::Domain.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for SageMaker by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::SageMaker::EndpointConfig.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for SageMaker by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::SageMaker::InferenceExperiment.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for SageMaker by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::SageMaker::NotebookInstance.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for SageMaker by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::SageMaker::PartnerApp.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for SageMaker by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::Scheduler::Schedule.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for Scheduler by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::SecretsManager::Secret.defaultBehavior: Encrypted with AWS managed key (aws/secretsmanager) by default.
AWS::SecretsManager::Secret.notes: Can specify customer managed KMS key. Encryption key can be changed after secret creation.

AWS::SecurityLake::DataLake.defaultBehavior: Encryption configuration optional. Check AWS documentation for service-specific defaults.

AWS::Serverless::Function.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for Serverless by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::Serverless::SimpleTable.defaultBehavior: Encryption configuration optional. Check AWS documentation for service-specific defaults.

AWS::StepFunctions::Activity.defaultBehavior: Encryption configuration optional. Check AWS documentation for service-specific defaults.

AWS::StepFunctions::StateMachine.defaultBehavior: Encryption configuration optional. Check AWS documentation for service-specific defaults.

AWS::Timestream::Database.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for Timestream by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::Timestream::ScheduledQuery.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for Timestream by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::VoiceID::Domain.defaultBehavior: Customer managed KMS key is required. No default encryption available.
AWS::VoiceID::Domain.notes: KmsKeyId is required - Voice ID does not support AWS managed keys.

AWS::Wisdom::Assistant.defaultBehavior: Encryption configuration optional. Check AWS documentation for service-specific defaults.

AWS::Wisdom::KnowledgeBase.defaultBehavior: Encryption configuration optional. Check AWS documentation for service-specific defaults.

AWS::WorkSpaces::Workspace.defaultBehavior: Not encrypted by default. Uses AWS managed key if encryption enabled without specifying KMS key.

AWS::WorkSpacesThinClient::Environment.defaultBehavior: Uses AWS managed key for WorkSpacesThinClient by default. Specify KMS key for customer managed encryption.

AWS::WorkspacesInstances::Volume.defaultBehavior: Not encrypted by default. Uses AWS managed key if encryption enabled without specifying KMS key.
